channel.title: Spring JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [DATAMONGO-974] synthetic field target's name is returned instead of the alias name
item.description:
Detected while trying to multiply a calculated result ($minute of a date field in this case) with a constant number, the command generated would be:

$multiply: [ 60000, "$date" ]

instead of the function performed on the date field in a previous projection (i.e: $multiply: [ 60000, "$my_minutes_field" ] )

found that the root cause of this issue is in the ExposedFields.getRaw() method which doesn't check if the field is synthetic:

public String getRaw()

{ String target = field.getTarget(); return field.synthetic ? target : String.format("%s.%s", Fields.UNDERSCORE_ID, target); }

I think it should be fixed this way:

String target = field.synthetic ? field.getName() : field.getTarget();
item.summary: synthetic field target's name is returned instead of the alias name

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
Hello Assaf,

thanks for reporting this - I just gave it a spin and the change you are suggesting breaks some tests.
How does your aggregation pipeline look like? Would you mind writing a little test case that reproduces this issue?

Cheers,
Thomas

Hi Thomas,

Below is a reduced case of what I'm trying to do, I get the following error while running it:

Caused by: org.springframework.dao.InvalidDataAccessApiUsageException: Command execution failed:  Error [exception: $multiply only supports numeric types, not Date], Command = { "aggregate" : "kpisAssaf" , "pipeline" : [ { "$project" : { "rtt" : 1 , "date" : 1 , "mi" : { "$minute" : [ "$date"]}}} , { "$project" : { "trunc_date_diff" : { "$multiply" : [ "$date" , 60000]} , "date" : 1 , "rtt" : 1}} , { "$project" : { "rtt" : 1 , "date" : { "$subtract" : [ "$date" , "$trunc_date_diff"]}}} , { "$group" : { "_id" : "$date" , "rtt" : { "$sum" : "$rtt"}}}]}; nested exception is com.mongodb.CommandFailureException: { "serverUsed" : "localhost:27017" , "errmsg" : "exception: $multiply only supports numeric types, not Date" , "code" : 16555 , "ok" : 0.0}
 
	at org.springframework.data.mongodb.core.MongoTemplate.handleCommandError(MongoTemplate.java:1933)
 
	at org.springframework.data.mongodb.core.MongoTemplate.aggregate(MongoTemplate.java:1414)
 
	at org.springframework.data.mongodb.core.MongoTemplate.aggregate(MongoTemplate.java:1336)
 
	at org.springframework.data.mongodb.core.MongoTemplate.aggregate(MongoTemplate.java:1325)
 

public AggregationResults<KPI> assaf() {
 
 
 
    	Fields fields = Aggregation.fields("date");
 
    	
    	ProjectionOperation po1 = Aggregation.project()
 
    			.andInclude("rtt")
 
    			.andInclude("date")
 
    			.and("date").project("minute").as("mi");
 
    	
    	/************* this one is causing the issue *******************/
 
    	ProjectionOperation po2 = Aggregation.project().andInclude("rtt")
 
    			.and("date").minus("trunc_date_diff").as("date");
 
    	
    	ProjectionOperation po3  = Aggregation.project().and("mi").multiply(60000).as("trunc_date_diff").andInclude("date").andInclude("rtt");
 
    	
    	GroupOperation groupOperation = Aggregation.group(fields).sum("rtt").as("rtt");
 
    	
    	TypedAggregation<KPI> aggregation = Aggregation.newAggregation(KPI.class, po1, po3, po2, groupOperation );
 
    	
    	return mongoOperations.aggregate(aggregation, KPI.class);
 
    }

with class KPI as follows:

import java.util.Date;
 
 
 
import org.springframework.data.annotation.Id;
 
import org.springframework.data.mongodb.core.mapping.Document;
 
import org.springframework.data.mongodb.core.mapping.Field;
 
 
 
@Document(collection = "kpisAssaf")
 
public class KPI {
 
 
 
	@Id
 
    private String id;
 
 
 
    private Date date;
 
    private long rtt;
 
    
 
 
    public Date getDate() {
 
        return date;
 
    }
 
 
 
    public void setDate(Date date) {
 
        this.date = date;
 
    }
 
 
 
    public long getRtt() {
 
        return rtt;
 
    }
 
 
 
    public void setRtt(long rtt) {
 
        this.rtt = rtt;
 
    }
 
}

thanks,
Assaf

Hello Assaf,

this should be fixed with the changes in DATAMONGO-975.
Would you mind giving the PR listed there a spin?

Cheers,
Thomas

Hi Thomas,

I'm getting other errors with the build I did from the PR
java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: org/springframework/data/mapping/model/FieldNamingStrategy

probably not related to this change, might have to wait for the release to test this.

thanks,
Assaf

Hi Assaf,

the M1 release is now available. You need to update your Spring Data Commons dependency as well

Cheers,
Thomas
